full_text: STATEMENT RECONCILIATION INSTRUCTIONS: STATEMENT BALANCE $ DEPOSITS MADE BUT 1. Subtract from your checkbook balance the monthly ADD - NOT SHOWN ON THIS STATEMENT service charge and any other Bank charge not previous- ly deducted from your checkbook. TOTAL $ 2. Sort the paid checks received with your statement into numerical order or by issue date. CHECKS SUBTRACT OUTSTANDING 3. Compare and check off () paid checks against your SHOULD AGREE TOTAL WITH YOUR CHECK $ checkbook record. BOOK BALANCE List checks not accounted for in the box to the right marked "CHECKS OUTSTANDING." CHECKS OUTSTANDING 4. Complete statement reconciliation. CHECK AMOUNT NUMBER 5. SUGGESTED STEPS TO BE FOLLOWED IF YOUR CHECK- BOOK AND BANK STATEMENT DO NOT BALANCE. -Review last month's reconcilement to determine that any difference was corrected, e.g. Bank's charges de- ducted from stub balance, etc. -Verify additions and subtractions in your checkbook. -Compare the amount of each paid check with the matching stub in your checkbook. -Compare the amount of each deposit shown in your checkbook with deposits shown on the Bank statement. -Be sure that each check issued has been entered in the stub portion of your checkbook. ENTER IN THE SPACE TOTAL $ PROVIDED ABOVE
